A drawing_definition is an identification and categorization, by type, of a set of drawing versions.
When the need for a drawing is identified, a drawing definition begins its existence when the organization assigns a drawing number.

ext_description.note: Drawing numbers themselves are often composed of parts such as: a type prefix, a part number (or stem), and a suffix. Its composition is provided by the originating organization.
ext_description.example: "CK123456-789", "DL-S12345", "1B5102-04", and "1D55500" are examples of drawing number strings.

ext_description.p:
a
used to describe the functional categorization of the drawing.
ext_description.note: A type of drawing is used to communicate a specific portion of the information about a product. For a printed wiring assembly, the functional aspects are communicated by means of a schematic diagram whereas the physical aspects are communicated by means of another drawing type.
ext_description.example: "SCHEMATIC DIAGRAM", "SITE PLAN", "DETAIL", and "ASSEMBLY" are examples of drawing-type labels. Additional examples for drawing-type labels may be found in ISO 10209-1.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A drawing_revision is a type of . A drawing_revision is a version of a drawing, resulting from creation or change.

ext_description.p: an identifier for the revision of the drawing.
ext_description.note: The values for this representation may be comprised of any allowable characters. Any limit or restrictions must be specified in an Application Protocol. Typically the revision identifier is an alphanumeric string.
ext_description.example: The revision identifier may be "A", "AA", "2.4", or could be "31".

ext_description.p: a text description of the intended drawing scale where the description is for information only.
The identifier for a version of a drawing shall be unique for that drawing.
ext_description.example: A drawing revision identified by the letter "A" is the only drawing revision identified by that letter in the set of revisions of a particular drawing.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A drawing_revision_sequence is the successive relationship of one version to another for the same drawing.
If two drawing revisions were identified by revision identifiers equal to A and B successively, the drawing revision identified by A would play the role of predecessor and the drawing revision identified by B would play the role of successor in the sequence of drawing revisions.
a version of a drawing which precedes another version of a drawing.

ext_description.p: a version of a drawing which succeeds another version of a drawing.
ext_description.note: A drawing version (i.e., ) may precede or succeed another version of the same drawing or a version of a different drawing (i.e., not identified by the same ) in a logical sequence of drawings.

ext_description.p: A particular revision of a drawing shall not precede nor succeed itself.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A drawing_sheet_revision is a type of . A drawing_sheet_revision is a version of a drawing sheet. It may either be an initial version or a modification of a previous version.
As a type of , the drawing_sheet_revision provides the information necessary to present a version of a drawing sheet. It also specifies the administrative data used to manage a version of a drawing sheet, with respect to the drawing revision.

A draughting_title is brief text describing the contents of the drawing or drawing sheet. It is draughting application-specific, language-dependent, and may be applicable to more than one drawing or drawing sheet.
A drawing containing the mechanical compatibility information for a safety switching device may be given a text description such as "MECHANICAL COMPATIBILITY, SAFETY SWITCH", where the language is English.
